title: PRESENCE
name: PRESENCE
description:
After hours of rerouting, negotiating, and reimagining, the students have adapted their original plan to fit the current circumstances. 

Armed with their lock boxes, police liason contact numbers, and hand-painted signs, they enter the Main Building, march to the President's office chanting, and promptly lock themselves to his desk.

18 students lock themselves in in protest of the university suppressing student voice and using sweatshop labor. By the end of the sit-in, 14 are arrested for tresspaassing and disturbance.

President Wethington does not meet with students. He does not negotiate for a later meeting date, he does not accept their petition or signed letters.
